Legal_Issue: Validity of RPD's decision to dismiss refugee claim
Procedural_Context: Amendment of decision post-decision; use of evidence
Credibility_Assessment: Lack of credible evidence of persecution
Evidence_Type: Undisclosed evidence, clerical errors, boilerplate reasoning
Legal_Provision: Principles of natural justice, functus officio doctrine
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility of applicant and sufficiency of evidence
Application_Error: Alleged procedural errors in amending decision
Review_Outcome: No violation of functus officio or natural justice
Evidence_Ignored: Outdated or undisclosed evidence deemed immaterial
Application_Factor: Correction of clerical errors without substantive change
Decision_Review_Issue: Legality of amendments and fairness of process
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Functus officio doctrine, Principles of natural justice
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence of persecution
Evidentiary_Issues: Use of boilerplate reasoning, handling of undisclosed evidence
Credibility_Issues: Applicant lacked credibility regarding persecution claims
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on functus officio and natural justice
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Administrative law principles
